newsitem.title: USA: Netscape to offer 5 mln common shares.
newsitem.headline: Netscape to offer 5 mln common shares.

text.p: Netscape Communications Corp said Wednesday it has filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission for the public offering of five million shares of its common stock.
Netscape is offering two million of the shares with the balance to be sold by certain selling stockholders.
The shares will be offered by an underwriting group managed by Morgan Stanley & Co, Deutsche Morgan Grenfell Inc, Goldman Sachs & Co and Hambrecht & Quist.
Netscape said in a statement it has granted the underwriters an option to purchase up to an additional 750,000 shares from the company to cover over-allotments, if any.

In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Netscape said the selling stockholders are Adobe Systems Inc, TCI Netscape Holdings Inc, Knight-Ridder Investment Co, a Knight-Ridder Inc unit, and Hearst Corp.

Adobe and TCI Netscape propose to sell 888,890 shares each. Adobe will cut its stake to 908,273 shares or 1.0 percent and TCI Netscape to 755,562 shares or less than 1.0 percent after the offering. Adobe and TCI Netscape each currently hold a 2.1 percent stake.
Knight-Ridder plans to sell 888,892 shares, representing its entire 1.1 percent stake, while Hearst may sell 200,000 shares, cutting its stake to 688,892 shares or less than 1.0 percent.
